title: Ken Livingstone apologises 'unreservedly' for insulting MP with history of depression - Politics live | Politics | The Guardian
summary: labour says cameron 'staggeringly wrong ' about police numbers in london .
livingstone suggests money spent on trident could be better used increasing size of army .
kevan jones says livingstone 's apology does not go far enough .
livingstone apologises `` unreservedly '' for insulting kevan jones .
mcfadden criticises livingstone for not issuing a proper apology .

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: ken livingstone has issued an unequivocal apology for saying the shadow minister kevan jones might need some psychiatric help '' .
he finally issued a proper apology under pressure from jeremy corbyn , the labour leader , after at first refusing to say sorry , and then offering a half-hearted one .

the row about his comments about jones , who has a history of depression , overshadowed a separate controversy about whether it was wise to appoint livingstone , a strong opponent of trident , as co-chair of labour 's defence review alongside maria eagle , the pro-trident shadow defence secretary .
livingstone defended the arrangement .
( see 2.26pm . )
in an interview a few minutes ago , eagle sounded less keen .
norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) q : how do u feel about working with ken livingstone ?

maria eagle : i 'm sanguine about it david cameron has told mps britain can not dodge forever '' the need to attack islamic state at the source by extending raf airstrikes to syria , making it clear that he intends to bring the issue back to the commons at some point .
peers have started debating an amendment to the eu referendum bill that would allow 16 and 17-year-olds to vote in the poll .
opening the debate for labour , eluned morgan , a shadow foreign minister , said allowing votes at 16 in the scottish independence referendum had been a success .

more 16 and 17-year-olds voted [ in the scottish independence referendum ] than 18 to 24-year-olds and evidence from austria and norway , where they also have votes for 16 to 18-year-olds , suggests they are more likely to continue voting if they start at a younger age .

andy burnham , the shadow home secretary , has warned theresa may that she will put public safety at risk if she agrees to cut the policing budget by more than 5 % over the next five years in next week 's spending review .

amber rudd , the energy secretary , has said the uk will close all coal-fired power plants by 2025 , the first major country to do so , but will fill the capacity gap largely with new gas and nuclear plants rather than cleaner alternatives .
conservatives received almost £ 3.4m in donations over the third quarter of 2015 - more than double the 1.6 million received by labour , electoral commission figures have revealed .

as the press association reports , while labour 's top donors were all trade unions , the biggest sum given to the tories was £ 400,000 from the national conservative draws society , a weekly lottery played by conservative members to raise funds for marginal seats .
that 's all from me for today .
thanks for the comments .

the survation poll ( see 3.36pm ) suggests the public have reservations about bombing islamic state ( isis ) in syria because it shows , when offered a choice , people would prefer britain getting involved in a multilateral solution .
but , when the question is phrased another way , people do seem to favour bombing .
according to this yougov survey ( pdf ) , when asked if the raf should take part in air strikes against isis in syria , 58 % said they were in favour and only 22 % said they were opposed .
the survey also found overwhelming support for the decision to kill the isis fighter and executioner mohammed emwazi in a drone strike .
some 76 % said it was the right thing to do , and 11 % said it was wrong .
the same poll also found that david cameron 's net approval rating ( those who say he is doing well , minus those who say he is doing badly ) at -4 ; jeremy corbyn 's is -22 .
hopi sen has been looking at corbyn 's figures in detail , and comparing them to ed miliband 's .
hopi sen ( @ hopisen ) i used today 's @ twitterid poll to compare how people think corbyn is doing with ed miliband 5 years ago .
not great .

hopi sen ( @ hopisen ) the good news for corbyn is in every group more think he 's doing very well than thought ed was 5 years ago but hopi sen ( @ hopisen ) bad news is his enthusiasts are dwarfed by those who think he 's doing very badly .
he is fairly polarising .
hopi sen ( @ hopisen ) it 's fair to say corbyn is not going down very well among over 60s .
among 18-24s & labour voters it 's closer

documents.title: labour says cameron 'staggeringly wrong ' about police numbers in london
text: at pmqs david cameron also said that neighbourhood policing numbers had gone up by 3,800 and that in the capital city there had been a 500 % increase in neighbourhood policing . ''
labour say this is staggeringly wrong '' .
this is from joanne mccartney , labour 's policing spokeswoman in the london assembly .
the prime minister is staggeringly wrong to say that neighbourhood policing has increased in london , it has n't gone up 1 % let alone 500 % .
since may 2010 the capital has lost 5,702 uniformed officers from its neighbourhood policing teams .
that 's 2,497 pcs and 3,205 pcsos lost who could have been on our streets fighting crime in the capital .
it 's clear that the prime minister has absolutely no idea what impact his cuts are having on the capital 's police force .
not only have we seen thousands of police officers cut from neighbourhood policing but crime in the capital is now on the rise , with violent crime up 21 % over the last 12 months .
police officers on patrol in london stothard/getty images

the survation poll came up at pmqs when angus robertson , the snp leader at westminster , asked david cameron if he would seek a united nations security council resolution before taking military action against islamic state ( isis ) in syria .
robertson mentioned the survation figures ( see 3.36pm ) in one of his questions about this .
cameron said that it was always preferable '' to have un backing , but he made it clear that he was prepared to act without it .
of course , it 's always preferable in these circumstances to have the fulling backing of the un security council .
i have to say what matters most of all is any action we take would both be legal and would help to protect our country and people right here .

you can not , as i said yesterday , outsource to a russian veto the decisions we need to keep our country safe if they are vetoed or threatened with a veto over and over again , my job , frankly , as prime minister is not to read a survation opinion poll but to do the right thing to keep our country safe .
angus robertson
last night survation published some polling figures looking at public opinion on air strikes against islamic state ( isis ) .
two findings stand out .
a majority of people think bombing isis has made britain less safe .
only 18 % think it has made britain more safe , and 56 % think the opposite .

survation poll a majority of people think britain should tackle isis by [ engaging ] with all countries to coordinate an appropriate response , militarily or otherwise , backed by a united nations resolution '' .
some 52 % favoured this approach , and only 15 % said britain should respond to the paris attacks by launching air strikes against isis in syria immediately .

survation poll this last finding is significant because working with other countries on an international response , backed by the un , is close to the position agreed by the labour party at its conference in september
ken livingstone told the guardian that he spoke to maria eagle about his views on trident two weeks ago but has not yet spoken to her about the defence review .
i had a chat with maria about nuclear weapons a couple of weeks ago - we passed in the street .
i 'm sure we can work together , i 've known her for many years , we will get on .
he claimed that his appointment to the review was made by the national executive committee ( nec ) because of a longstanding party arrangement .
labour 's nec has to appoint people to each major policy review .
the economy , environment and defence each have one person from the shadow cabinet and one from the nec .
i am sure she [ eagle ] knew about this .
she has since denied knowing about livingstone 's role until it emergedon social media .
here 's the guardian audio of ken livingstone 's world at one apology .

norman lamb , the lib dem health spokesman and a campaigner on mental health , has condemned ken livingstone for what he said about kevan jones , saying comments like this set back progress in tackling the stigmaa around mental health '' .
lib dem press office ( @ libdempress ) .
@ normanlamb : remarks like this ( from ken livingstone ) set back progress in tackling the stigma around mental health

documents.title: livingstone suggests money spent on trident could be better used increasing size of army
text: and here are some more lines from ken livingstone 's world at one interview .
livingstone said kevan jones was wrong to say that he did not know about defence .
( see 9.38am . )
i have been involved in debate about military intervention going back to vietnam .
i was responsible as leader of the glc for civil defence in london .
we knew what the consequences of a nuclear strike would be .
i was responsible for trying to put in place the response to the suicide attacks that we had 10 years ago .
i 'm afraid that i do have a bit of a record in this area and he should have known about that .
he said labour 's defence review would be driven by facts , not pre-existing views .
the object of this review is to look at where we are now and to look at the facts .

it is not about your opinions , your beliefs , the moral debate about killing people ; it 's the question is £ 20bn the best way to spend our military budget at a time when the real threat to us , as we have just seen from the attacks in paris , is from terrorists on the street .
and they are not deterred by nuclear weapons .
and also the argentines were not deterred by nuclear weapons from invading the falklands .
he claimed that he would be able to work together with maria eagle , the shadow defence secretary , on the labour defence review even though they disagreed on trident .
i 've know her since she was 21 , back in 1981 , when she invited me to come and talk to her labour students club , and she took me out for a nice meal .
and in the ensuing 35 years we 've always got on fine .
i do n't think maria eagle is excited about having nuclear weapons and being able to kill people .
she wants to be able to see a way through this problem , to make us a safe country ; so do i .
he suggested that the money spent on trident could be better invested in expanding the size of the army .
[ eagle ] and i need to sit down and look at the facts , get real data , and see if this is the best way of spending our money .
at the moment , under this government , our army is the smallest it 's been since the first world war .
and that 's making us vulnerable .

documents.title: kevan jones says livingstone 's apology does not go far enough
text: kevan jones is now saying ken livingstone should apologise to all the other people he has offended .
kevan jones mp ( @ kevanjonesmp ) @ guidofawkes and what about apologising to other thousands of people he insulted .

documents.title: livingstone apologises `` unreservedly '' for insulting kevan jones
text: ken livingstone has now come out with a proper apology to kevan jones - following his half-hearted one earlier .
( see 1.57pm . )
ken livingstone ( @ ken4london ) 1/2 i unreservedly apologise to kevan jones for my comments .
they should not have been made at all , let alone in this context .
ken livingstone ( @ ken4london ) 2/2 i also make this apology because jeremy is right to insist on a more civil politics and as a party we should take this seriously

documents.title: livingstone 's apology - or 'apology ' - in full
text: here is the ken livingstone apology in full .
i had no idea that he had any mental health issues , otherwise i would never have said it .
if he 's upset i 'm sorry .
but he ca n't blame me .
he was the one that came out and made this attack on me and questioned by competence to do this job .
i just think it 's time labour mps stopped undermining jeremy corbyn 's decisions and his appointments .
our job is to get rid of this government and we should be united .
for all my disagreements with tony blair , i called on people to vote for him .
i never said he was n't fit to govern .

and this is what he said when martha kearney suggested livingstone 's language was inappropriate even if he did not know about jones ' mental health problems ( which kearney said was surprising , given that they have had some publicity . )
well , i grew up in south london .
if someone was rude to you , you were rude to back to them .
i did not got to eton and get all that smarmy charming education , i 'm afraid .
so sorry about that .
does this count as a proper apology ?
ken livingstone did come up with a sentence that contained the words i 'm sorry '' and so technically this just about qualifies .
but it is about as measly an apology as you can get .
politicians are rather fond of the 'i 'm sorry that ' apology ( ie , i 'm sorry that you 're offended ) and they use them much more often than i 'm sorry for ' apology ( i 'm sorry for what i did ) .
this was in the former category .
and livingstone did not even even remotely contrite .
i described it on twitter as half-hearted .
my colleague patrick wintour was less generous .
patrick wintour ( @ patrickwintour ) @ andrewsparrow quarter hearted .
and sky 's kay burley put it like this .
kay burley ( @ kayburley ) boyfriend apology

documents.title: mcfadden criticises livingstone for not issuing a proper apology
text: pat mcfadden , the shadow europe minister , has just told the world at one that ken livingstone should issue a proper apology for what he said about kevan jones .
he said livingstone 's apology a few minutes ago did not count as such .
mcfadden said : if you are going to apologise , do it properly , not in a half-hearted or dismissive way .
livingstone says jones was rude about him , because he said he did not know anything about defence .
but in fact he does , he says .
he says he has been interested in defence issues since he campaigned against the vietnam war .
and , when he was leader of the greater london council , he was responsible for civil defence , he says .
he also plays down suggestions that he will not be able to work on labour 's defence review with maria eagle .
he has known her for 35 years , he says , since he spoke at a labour event she organised when she was a student , and they get on fine .
the interview is over .
i will post full quotes soon .
martha kearney is interviewing ken livingstone .
q : but , even if you did not know about jones 's depression - and he has been very open about it - is n't it right that you should n't be using language like this ?
livingstone says he grew up in south london .
he did not go to eton , where he was taught manners .
if someone is rude about me , i 'm rude back to them , '' he says .
kearney points out that jones did not go to eton ; he was the son of a miner .

documents.title: livingstone says he is sorry for upsetting kevan jones
text: ken livingstone has just apologised for what he said about kevan jones .
he told the world at one that he had no idea that jones had problems with depression .
if he 's upset , i 'm sorry .
here is a guardian video of the highlights from pmqs .
on the daily politics the labour mp john mann was asked after pmqs if he had confidence in jeremy corbyn as leader .
pointedly , he refused to say that he had .
he said he had confidence in hilary benn , the shadow foreign secretary .

documents.title: pmqs - verdict
text: pmqs - verdict : jeremy corbyn should not be too worried by that - because it could have been a lot worse .
corbyn started off with two neutral , consensual questions , and even when he did start asking hostile ones , they were only in the moderately difficult category .
and this made it slightly tricky for david cameron , who was clearly itching to attack .

in his third answer , when corbyn was still being relatively gentlemanly , cameron unleashed a sly but rather pointed jibe about politicians not being able to dodge forever '' a decision about confronting islamic state .

he then delivered some routine attack lines about economic competence before , right at the end , coming out with the most effective line of the exchanges , the one about the police needing the power to shoot to kill '' .
has n't it come to something when the leader of the opposition thinks that the police , when confronted by a kalashnikov-waving terrorist is n't sure what the reaction should be ?

as i said earlier , this may sound a bit unfair , but jeremy corbyn only has himself to blame for getting himself into the position where cameron can de him as someone who would dither about authorising force even while gunmen were running amok .

perhaps , when corbyn answered laura kuenssberg 's question about this on the bbc on monday ( details here ) , the labour leader was thinking of suspect bombers ( like the one jean charles de menezes was n't ) being assassinated not gun-wielding jihadis .
this is conceivable , although it would have been odd for corbyn not to realise what he was being asked given that he was being interviewed about the paris attacks .
corbyn subsequently clarified his stance yesterday .
but on monday night , according to at least one account , corbyn was not prepared to tell the plp that he would approve of shoot to kill '' in cameron 's kalashnikov-waving terrorist '' scenario .
if you are finding this subject tedious already , then i 'm afraid i 've got bad news ; cameron is likely to keep at this for as long as corbyn leads labour .
but , in the circumstances , corbyn got off lightly .
just imagine the fun cameron could have had with today 's ken livingstone shambles .
( corbyn , to his credit , has said livingstone should apologise , but cameron could have challenged corbyn to sack him from the defence review if he does n't say sorry . )
partly corbyn limited the damage by playing a defensive game ; by asking neutral or relatively restrained questions , he made it harder for cameron to attack him .
but why did n't he ask the jonathan reynolds question ( see 12.23pm ) which was superb ?
and a more effective opposition leader would have found it hard to lose by asking about the latest health spending warnings .
labour 's yvonne fovargue also asks about council cuts .
should she blame the council , or the government ?
cameron says she should blame the last labour government , which left the biggest deficit in the western world .
and that 's it .
pmqs is over .
i 'll post a full verdict soon .
labour 's jonathan reynolds welcomes cameron as the new leader of the anti-austerity movement in oxfordshire '' .
( that 's a reference to this . )
how is his campaign going ?
cameron says he wants all councils to become more efficient .
if reynolds ' council writes to him , it will get the same advice .
sir alan haselhurst , a conservative , says spending on sport should be protected because of the role in can play in community cohesion .
cameron says sporting bodies should do more themselves .
they receive large sums of money from tv .
labour 's imran hussain asks about the closure of an hmrc office in bradford .
it could have a catastrophic impact on the city , he says .
cameron says a treasury minister will meet local mps .
the government will ensure support is there for people who lose their jobs .
but unemployment in bradford is down , he says .
and everyone has an interest in hmrc becoming more effective .
jack lopresti , a conservative , says he is alarmed by the arrest of a former paratrooper over bloody sunday .
many terrorists were released as part of the good friday agreement , he says .
cameron says one of the best thing about this country is that the prosecuting authorities are independent .
we should respect that , even when they take decisions we might want to question '' .
labour 's tulip siddiq says morale amongst junior doctors is lower than at any time .
does cameron agree this is a threat to patient safety ?
cameron says junior doctors should think very , very carefully before voting to go on strike .
anyone working legal hours will not be worse off under the new contract .
they should use the wage calculator on the nhs website to check .
cameron says very , very brave '' people work in hereford ( the sas ) .
labour 's john mann says his niece was caught up in the paris attacks .
she wants to know if emergency services will be able to cope in this country in the light of cuts .
and why is the government not pushing for a un resolution on syria ?
cameron says the government has been preparing for a paris-style attack for years .
it has ensured that the emergency services will be available .
and the armed services will be able to surge '' onto the streets if necessary .
cameron ignores the thrust of the question ( which was about public service cuts ) and he ignores the question about the un .
craig tracey , a conservative , asks about incentives for innovators .
cameron says he wants to rebalance the british economy .
manufacturers want more investment into catapult centres .
they want more apprenticeships .
and they want the investment allowance to be permanent .
the government will ensure that , he says .

documents.title: pmqs - snap verdict
text: pmqs - snap verdict : it took a while for cameron to deliver the decisive blow , but he got there right at the end , with his well-polished kalashnikov-wielding terrorist '' line .

it was a tad unfair ( because we can presume that in these circumstances corbyn does approve of the trigger being pulled ) , but the labour leader has only himself to blame because of the hopeless woolliness of his response to a question on this in his bbc interview on monday .
that said , today went better for corbyn than yesterday 's commons statements and his questions were strong and serious .
corbyn says he has a question from john .
demand on police has increased .
one in three police officers is considering leaving the police .
will it be protected ?
cameron repeats the point about the numbers of neighbour police officers going up .
but the police also need the right powers .
does n't it come to something when , if the police are confronted by a kalashnikov-wielding terrorist , the leader of the opposition does not know what their response should be .
corbyn says policing plays a vital role in community cohesion .
but if police numbers are cut by 5,000 this will be undermined .
does cameron agree with bernard hogan-howe , the met commissioner , that these cuts will cause real problems ?
cameron says money comes from taxpayers .
he repeats the figures about neighbourhood police numbers going up , and crime going down .
andy burnham says cuts of 10 % are achievable .
does corbyn agree ?
there seems to be disagreement on the labour front bench today .
corbyn asks where the extra funding for the security services will come when we get the spending review next week .
cameron says the security services will get an extra 1,900 personnel .
and there will be extra aviation security .
but this will be part of an overall settlement .
you need a strong economy to have strong defence , he says .
corbyn says we need to cut off isil 's funding .
are our allies doing all they can to clamp down on individuals and institutions backing isil .
will cameron back the use of sanctions to stop this ?
cameron says the government plays a leading role in imposing sanctions .
but isil developed because syria was unstable .
that is how it was able to obtain money and oil .
so we can not dodge forever the question how to address isil .
that is why he will be responding to the foreign affairs committee .
corbyn says intolerance often increases after attacks like this .
does cameron agree that politicians should be careful what they say ?
and does he agree this had nothing to do with the 2m muslims in britain .
cameron agrees .
he says these butchers of isil are nothing to do with islam .
but they spout bile that they claim comes from islam .
they are making a connection .
we must prove they are wrong , he says .
jeremy corbyn asks about the support given to british nationals affected by the paris attacks .
and what is the government 's advice about travelling to paris .
cameron thanks corbyn for his remarks , and says it was a pleasure to be with him at the england v france match .
corbyn was right to say there could never be a justification for terrorism .
he says the british ambassador in france has done a brilliant job .
people should carry on with their lives , and continue to enjoy paris , he says .
we will not be cowed . ''
andrew rosindell , a conservative , says the government should protect the government .
will he take complete control over borders , and complete sovereignty from the eu ?
cameron says because britain is not in schengen , it has control over borders already .
some 6,500 eu nationals have been stopped from coming to the uk since 2010 , and 95,000 people overall have been stopped since 2010 .
labour 's gordon marsden associates himself with what david cameron has said about the paris attacks .
people from blackpool , his constituency , were murdered in tunisia , he says .
he asks cameron to reflect on police cuts , and the words 'when facts change , i change my mind ' .
david cameron says he can updated mps on paris .
one british national was killed in the bataclan theatre .
three british nationals have been returned to the uk and another 15 are being treated for trauma .
the government has protected counter-terorrism policing , he says .
there has been an increase in the number of officers on the beat , he says .
and crime has fallen by 31 % .

documents.title: pmqs
text: pmqs starts in two minutes .
tim sculthorpe ( @ timsculthorpe ) no immediate sign of maria eagle or kevan jones with five minutes to # pmqs .
hard session for corbyn beckons you 'd imagine .
two more labour mps have criticised ken livingstone .
from toby perkins , a shadow defence minister ( like kevan jones ) toby perkins ( @ tobyperkinsmp ) luciana berger absolutely right , seems only @ twitterid still thinking ken is in the right .
from simon danczuk simon danczuk ( @ simondanczuk ) @ elashton : ken livingstone says labour mp who suffered from depression is `` disturbed '' disgraceful .
lisa nandy , the shadow energy secretary , has just told the daily politics that no one in politics should speak about people in the terms that ken livingstone was using about kevan jones .
i do n't think anybody should be making comments like that about anybody else in politics , '' she said .
politicians had to set the right tone for national debate , she added .
george galloway , the former labour mp who joined respect , is defending ken livingstone .
george galloway ( @ georgegalloway ) the witch-hunt turns on ken livingstone .
tooth by tooth claw by claw they are trying to defang jc .
i defend ken .
chuka umunna , the former shadow business secretary , has accused ken livingstone of spreading prejudice '' .
chuka umunna ( @ chukaumunna ) prejudice comes in many forms - very disappointed to see the man i campaigned for to be mayor seemingly spreading it
luciana berger , the shadow minister for mental health , says that , in stigmatising those people with depression , livingstone 's comments are as serious as racism or sexism '' .
he should apologise immediately , she says .
luciana berger ( @ lucianaberger ) my response to @ twitterid4london 's mental health related comments

documents.title: corbyn says livingstone should apologise
text: jeremy corbyn has now put out a statement saying ken livingstone should apologise .
he said : jeremy is incredibly concerned that people with mental health problems should n't be stigmatised .
he has worked with kevan in the past on this issue and is impressed by his bravery in speaking out on his own mental health issues .
ken should apologise to him straight away .
jeremy corbyn ( centre ) at last night 's england v france football match sibley/reuters

documents.title: mps condemn livingstone as a 'disgrace ' and 'unacceptable ' over his kevan jones comments
text: labour mps are taking to twitter to condemn ken livingstone .
here are three of them .
from tom blenkinsop tom blenkinsop ( @ tomblenkinsop ) livingstone blasts labour rival with depression claiming he is 'disturbed ' & should 'see his gp ' what a disgrace !
from neil coyle neil coyle ( @ coyleneil ) hope ken livingstone big enough to apologise asap for offence caused over mental health slur .
unnecessary distraction in already tough time from john woodcock john woodcock ( @ jwoodcockmp ) regardless of political differences between you , @ twitterid4london , this is unacceptable .
please withdraw and say sorry
and here is more from what ken livingstone told lbc .
theo usherwood ( @ theousherwood ) ken livingstone tells @ twitterid : if someone is rude to me then they can expect me to be rude back .
ken livingstone has just been on lbc , where he refused four times to apologise for what he said about kevan jones .
craig woodhouse ( @ craigawoodhouse ) livingstone refuses to apologise four times on lbc re kevan jones comments .
`` he was rude about me , i was rude back he needs to get over it ''
angus robertson , the snp 's leader at westminster , has confirmed that the snp will hold a debate on trident next week .
angus robertson ( @ angusrobertson ) confirmation that opposition day debates by @ twitterid next week will be on trident renewal and closure of hmrc offices # effectiveopposition
but ken livingstone is not retracting what he said .
pippa crerar ( @ pippacrerar ) ken livingstone tells me he was not aware that kevan jones suffered from depression - but refuses to retract his remarks .
ken livingstone is now claiming that he did not know kevan jones had a history of depression when he said he needed psychiatric help .
paul waugh ( @ paulwaugh ) just asked @ twitterid4london if he was aware of @ twitterid history of depression : `` i 've never heard of him b4 '' [ he attacked me on defence rvw ]
kevan jones has also posted a tweet saying ken livingstone 's comments are shocking '' .
kevan jones mp ( @ kevanjonesmp ) ken livingstone says labour mp with depression is 'disturbed ' in shocking attack

documents.title: livingstone says mp who criticised his appointment 'might need psychiatric help '
text: ken livingstone has hit back at kevan jones .
( see 9.38am . )
and it is not very pleasant .
this is what livingstone told the daily mirror .
i think [ jones ] might need some psychiatric help .
he 's obviously very depressed and disturbed .
he should pop off and see his gp before he makes these offensive comments .

jones , who has suffered from depression in the past and who won plaudits after talking about his problem in a speech in the house of commons , told the mirror livingstone was being gravely offensive '' .
the full mirror story is here .
kevan jones m pinder
according to the bbc 's carole walker , maria eagle was not told about ken livingstone 's appointment until news of it emerged on twitter .
carole walker ( @ carolewalkercw ) maria eagle was not told about ken livingstone 's appointment to trident review before it appeared on twitter
a source close to maria eagle , the shadow defence secretary , has said that she will still be leading the review despite ken livingstone 's appointment as co-chair of it .
the source said : maria and ken are co-convening the review and maria will still be leading it as was outlined by jeremy at conference .
trident will be just one of many issues the review will look at ; there is n't a separate review .

documents.title: livingstone claims most labour mps do n't support trident renewal
text: here is more of what ken livingstone said about trident in the russia today clip i posted earlier .
( see 9.46am . )
most labour mps do n't actually believe that trident is worth spending £ 20bn on .
they just worry that it will be the tory press demonising us as pro-russian or weaklings and things like that .
it 's not a serious , rational judgement ; £ 20bn - that 's going to be about £ 1,000 in tax for every family in britain .
and here are two tweets from journalists on the ken livingstone appointment .
from patrick wintour , the guardian 's political editor patrick wintour ( @ patrickwintour ) corbyn in his election said unity would be his watchword .
ok for unilateralist from nec to co-convene def .

review but is livingstone unifier from tom newton dunn , the sun 's political editor tom newton dunn ( @ tnewtondunn ) senior labour mp texts with news about ken livingstone co-chairing labour defence review `` you could n't make this shit up '' .
here is some more twitter comment on the appointment of ken livingstone as co-chair of labour 's defence review .
from the labour mp wes streeting wes streeting mp ( @ wesstreeting ) is this the same ken livingstone co-chairing labour 's defence review ?
from the former labour mp anne maguire anne mcguire ( @ annemcguire97 ) worthy of an armando iannucci script .
maybe it is ? bbc news - ken livingstone to co-chair labour 's trident review

documents.title: livingstone said maria eagle was 'mad ' if she really supported trident
text: the telegraph 's asa bennett has flagged up this footage of ken livingstone on russia today saying maria eagle ( his co-chair of labour 's defence review ) is mad '' is she really believes trident is worth spending money on .
the relevant bit starts at 1.40 in this video .

this helps to explain this tweet from lawrence freedman , the king 's college london professor of war studies and a member of the iraq inquiry lawrence freedman ( @ lawdavf ) interesting that ken livingstone to co-chair trident review with maria eagle .
lab clearly grasped concept of mutual assured destruction .

documents.title: shadow defence minister says appointment of livingstone to defence review will damage labour 's credibility
text: kevan jones , the labour former veterans minister and now a shadow defence minister , has criticised the appointment of ken livingstone as co-chair of the party 's defence policy review .
he told politicshome : i 'm not sure ken knows anything about defence .
it will only damage our credibility amongst those that do and who care about defence .
ken livingstone was on twitter last night criticising the call from the labour mp emma reynolds for a free vote on extending military action against islamic state to syria .
mps should accept that there is settled party policy on this , he said .
ken livingstone ( @ ken4london ) if pro-war mps want to support a war they should accept that there is a whip and decide whether to break it .
the labour mp wes streeting responded by asking if livingstone also wanted mps to have to vote in favour of existing party policy on trident .
wes streeting mp ( @ wesstreeting ) @ bbcallegra @ twitterid4london @ twitterid will this apply to trident , where policy is in favour but a number of mps ( jc incl ) do n't agree ?
jeremy corbyn , the labour leader , has already angered many of his mps this week with his comments on security policy .
overnight two new developments have occurred that will propel the long-standing split over trident into the headlines too .
ken livingstone , the former mayor of london and one of corbyn 's most prominent allies in the party , has been made a co-chair of labour 's defence review .

livingstone , who is opposed to nuclear weapons , will take joint charge of the review , which will help to decide the party 's policy on trident , with maria eagle , the pro-trident shadow defence secretary .
this is from the press association 's report .
the former london mayor , a long-time opponent of the nuclear deterrent , is to co-convene the party 's policy commission on defence issues alongside shadow defence secretary maria eagle .

the move is likely to cause fresh anger among labour mps , who have already savaged mr corbyn over his interventions in recent days it is understood the party 's commissions on major policy areas are generally co-convened '' by a member of the [ national executive committee , which livingstone sits on ] and the holder of the shadow cabinet brief .
recommendations are put to the national policy forum ( npf ) before being taken to party conference .
corbyn , a vice-president of cnd , has admitted that large numbers of labour mps favour the like-for-like replacement of trident .
but he has said he hopes to win them over to his view before a key commons vote over the coming months .
the bbc is reporting that the snp is planning to stage a vote on trident next tuesday .
the snp is opposed to trident and , at its party conference , angus robertson , the party 's leader at westminster , signalled that the party would use a commons vote to highlight splits in labour .
corbyn was elected labour leader on a platform that included unilateralism , but officially the party is still in favour of nuclear weapons .
according to the bbc 's norman smith , labour mps will be told to abstain - which means those who vote in favour of trident , and in favour of party policy , will be rebelling '' .

norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) understand likely commons vote on trident on tuesday by @ twitterid norman smith ( @ bbcnormans ) am hearing labour mps being told to abstain on @ twitterid trident vote i will post more on both these stories as the morning goes on .
here is the agenda for the day .
12pm : david cameron faces jeremy corbyn at pmqs .
around 3.30pm : peers will begin a debate on the eu referendum bill .

there will be a vote on a proposal backed by labour and lib dem peers to give 16 and 17-year-olds a vote in it , and there seems a good chance the government will lose when the vote comes at around 6pm .
4.25pm : sadiq khan , the labour candidate for london mayor , and zac goldsmith , his conservative counterpart , take part in a debate at a centre for london conference .
as usual , i will also be covering breaking political news as it happens , as well as bringing you the best reaction , comment and analysis from the web .
i will post a summary at lunchtime and another in the afternoon .
if you want to follow me or contact me on twitter , i 'm on @ andrewsparrow .

Livingstone says Jones may 'need psychiatric help'
